newsitem.title: JAPAN: Itochu, Nissho Iwai take stake in Singapore firm.
newsitem.headline: Itochu, Nissho Iwai take stake in Singapore firm.

text.p: Japanese trading houses Itochu Corp and Nissho Iwai Corp said on Friday that they would each take a stake in the Singapore holding company Asia Food & Properties Ltd.
Itochu will acquire 5.3 percent of Asia Food and Nissho Iwai 1.7 percent, they said in a statement.
A spokesman for Itochu said it would spend about $156 million to acquire the stake, while Nissho Iwai would spend $50 million for its stake.
Asia Food's shares went public on the Singapore Stock Exchange on Friday, hitting a high of $1.44 in early trade.
The Singapore company is a holding company of the property, food processing and distribution arm of Indonesian financial group Sinar Mas.
